hook.text: A team debates three options for hours, going in circles. Nobody can articulate why they prefer one over another.

buildup.text: Decision matrices score options against weighted criteria. They make trade-offs visible and reduce emotional bias.

discovery.text: The power isn't in the mathâ€”it's in forcing the team to agree on what matters most before evaluating choices.

twist.text: Matrices don't make decisionsâ€”they structure them. If the result feels wrong, question the criteria, not the tool.

climax.text: Use matrices for complex decisions with many stakeholders. Keep them simple: 3-5 criteria, clear weights, honest scores.

punchline.text: Good decisions start with agreeing on what matters.

quiz.question: What is the main benefit of a decision matrix?
options: It eliminates the need for discussion
